Measurement of serum methylmalonic acid levels is used to diagnose vitamin B12 and folate deficiencies. Measurement of erythrocyte folate levels is used to diagnose folate deficiencies.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest a deficiency in riboflavin (vitamin B2). Measurement of erythrocyte glutathione reductase activity (option D) is the most helpful diagnostic test to support this deficiency. This test evaluates the activity of an enzyme that requires both riboflavin and an electron carrier to function properly. If the enzyme activity is insufficient, it suggests a deficiency in riboflavin. Options A, B, and C are used to diagnose deficiencies in other vitamins (vitamin B6, vitamin B12, and folate, respectively).
